# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = Vector{String}()
    current_line = String()
    
    for word in words
        new_line = occursin(r"\s", word) || length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
        if new_line
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = String()
        end
        current_line *= " $word"
    end
    
    # Add the last line, even if it's empty
    push!(lines, current_line)

    join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
words = ["Lorem", "ipsum", "dolor", "sit", "amet,", "consectetur", "adipiscing", "elit."]
wrapped_text = wrap_string(words)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This function wraps the input words into lines that do not exceed `text_width` characters. The example demonstrates how to use this function with a list of words, and prints the wrapped text.
